text.p: Click on a column header to sort the table.

ROW.title: Record
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing record based information.

ROW.title: Institution ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

ROW.title: Collection ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the collection or dataset from which the record was derived. For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use the identifier in a collections registry such as the Biodiversity Collections Index (http://www.biodiversitycollectionsindex.org/).

ROW.title: Institution Code
ROW.tagdesc: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

ROW.title: Dataset ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

ROW.title: Collection Code
ROW.tagdesc: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

ROW.title: Dataset Name
ROW.tagdesc: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

ROW.title: Owner Institution Code
ROW.tagdesc: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

ROW.title: Basis Of Record
ROW.tagdesc: The specific nature of the data record - a subtype of the type. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Darwin Core Type Vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/type-vocabulary/index.htm).

ROW.title: Information Withheld
ROW.tagdesc: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

ROW.title: Data Generalizations
ROW.tagdesc: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

ROW.title: Dynamic Properties
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content such as key-value pairs.

ROW.title: Occurrence
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing occurrence based information.

ROW.title: Occurrence ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

ROW.title: Catalog Number
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

ROW.title: Occurrence Details
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. Details about the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Occurrence Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Record Number
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

ROW.title: Recorded By
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

ROW.title: Individual ID
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. An identifier for an individual or named group of individual organisms represented in the Occurrence. Meant to accommodate resampling of the same individual or group for monitoring purposes. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a data set.

ROW.title: Individual Count
ROW.tagdesc: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Organism Quantity
ROW.tagdesc: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

ROW.title: Organism Quantity Type
ROW.tagdesc: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

ROW.title: Sex
ROW.tagdesc: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Life Stage
ROW.tagdesc: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Reproductive Condition
ROW.tagdesc: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Behavior
ROW.tagdesc: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Establishment Means
ROW.tagdesc: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Occurrence Status
ROW.tagdesc: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Preparations
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

ROW.title: Disposition
ROW.tagdesc: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Other Catalog Numbers
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

ROW.title: Previous Identifications
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated Media
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of media associated with the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated References
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated Occurrences
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated Sequences
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated Taxa
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.

ROW.title: Organism
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing organism based information.

ROW.title: Organism ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Organism Name
ROW.tagdesc: A textual name or label assigned to an Organism instance.

ROW.title: Organism Scope
ROW.tagdesc: A description of the kind of Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Organism Associated Occurrences
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated with a vertical bar ' | ') of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

ROW.title: Associated Organisms
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated with a vertical bar ' | ' ) of identifiers of other Organisms and their associations to this Organism.

ROW.title: Previous Identifications
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated with a vertical bar ' | ' ) of previous assignments of names to the Organism.

ROW.title: Organism Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

ROW.title: Material Sample
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing material sample based information.

ROW.title: Living Specimen
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing living specimen based information. A specimen that is alive.

ROW.title: Preserved Specimen
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing preserved specimen based information. A specimen that has been preserved.

ROW.title: Fossil Specimen
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing fossil specimen based information. A preserved specimen that is a fossil.

ROW.title: Material Sample ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the material sample). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the materialSampleID globally unique.

ROW.title: Event
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing event based information.

ROW.title: Human Observation
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing human observation based information.

ROW.title: Machine Observation
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing machine observation based information.

ROW.title: Event ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Parent Event ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.

ROW.title: Event Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Event Earliest Date
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. (Child of Xmp.dwc.Event) The date-time or interval during which an Event started. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Event Latest Date
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. (Child of Xmp.dwc.Event) The date-time or interval during which an Event ended. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Event Time
ROW.tagdesc: The time or interval during which an Event occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Start Day Of Year
ROW.tagdesc: The earliest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

ROW.title: End Day Of Year
ROW.tagdesc: The latest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

ROW.title: Year
ROW.tagdesc: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

ROW.title: Month
ROW.tagdesc: The ordinal month in which the Event occurred.

ROW.title: Day
ROW.tagdesc: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

ROW.title: Verbatim Event Date
ROW.tagdesc: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

ROW.title: Habitat
ROW.tagdesc: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

ROW.title: Sampling Protocol
ROW.tagdesc: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.

ROW.title: Sampling Effort
ROW.tagdesc: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

ROW.title: Sampling Size Value
ROW.tagdesc: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

ROW.title: Sampling Size Unit
ROW.tagdesc: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

ROW.title: Field Number
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

ROW.title: Field Notes
ROW.tagdesc: One of (a) an indicator of the existence of, (b) a reference to (publication, URI), or (c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

ROW.title: Event Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the Event.

ROW.title: Location Class
ROW.tagdesc: Deprecated. Use Xmp.dcterms.Location instead. *Main structure* containing location based information.

ROW.title: Location ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Higher Geography ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the geographic region within which the Location occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an persistent identifier from a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

ROW.title: Higher Geography
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.

ROW.title: Continent
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names or the ISO 3166 Continent code.

ROW.title: Water Body
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

ROW.title: Island Group
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

ROW.title: Island
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

ROW.title: Country
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

ROW.title: Country Code
ROW.tagdesc: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.

ROW.title: State Province
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

ROW.title: County
ROW.tagdesc: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

ROW.title: Municipality
ROW.tagdesc: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.

ROW.title: Locality
ROW.tagdesc: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

ROW.title: Verbatim Locality
ROW.tagdesc: The original textual description of the place.

ROW.title: Verbatim Elevation
ROW.tagdesc: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

ROW.title: Minimum Elevation In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

ROW.title: Maximum Elevation In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

ROW.title: Verbatim Depth
ROW.tagdesc: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

ROW.title: Minimum Depth In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

ROW.title: Maximum Depth In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

ROW.title: Minimum Distance Above Surface In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

ROW.title: Maximum Distance Above Surface In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

ROW.title: Location According To
ROW.tagdesc: Information about the source of this Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals.

ROW.title: Location Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the Location.

ROW.title: Verbatim Coordinates
ROW.tagdesc: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

ROW.title: Verbatim Latitude
ROW.tagdesc: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

ROW.title: Verbatim Longitude
ROW.tagdesc: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

ROW.title: Verbatim Coordinate System
ROW.tagdesc: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Verbatim SRS
ROW.tagdesc: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

ROW.title: Decimal Latitude
ROW.tagdesc: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

ROW.title: Decimal Longitude
ROW.tagdesc: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

ROW.title: Geodetic Datum
ROW.tagdesc: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

ROW.title: Coordinate Uncertainty In Meters
ROW.tagdesc: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

ROW.title: Coordinate Precision
ROW.tagdesc: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

ROW.title: Point Radius Spatial Fit
ROW.tagdesc: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.

ROW.title: Footprint WKT
ROW.tagdesc: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Location. A Location may have both a point-radius representation (see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.

ROW.title: Footprint SRS
ROW.tagdesc: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the Spatial Reference System (SRS) for the footprintWKT of the Location. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude, even if it is the same as for the footprintWKT - use the geodeticDatum instead.

ROW.title: Footprint Spatial Fit
ROW.tagdesc: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point and the given georeference is not that same point. If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit is 1.

ROW.title: Georeferenced By
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the Location.

ROW.title: Georeferenced Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date on which the Location was georeferenced. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Georeference Protocol
ROW.tagdesc: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.

ROW.title: Georeference Sources
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

ROW.title: Georeference Verification Status
ROW.tagdesc: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Georeference Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

ROW.title: Geological Context
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing geological context based information.

ROW.title: Geological Context ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the set of information associated with a GeologicalContext (the location within a geological context, such as stratigraphy). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Earliest Eon Or Lowest Eonothem
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Latest Eon Or Highest Eonothem
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Earliest Era Or Lowest Erathem
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Latest Era Or Highest Erathem
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Earliest Period Or Lowest System
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Latest Period Or Highest System
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Earliest Epoch Or Lowest Series
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Latest Epoch Or Highest Series
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Earliest Age Or Lowest Stage
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Latest Age Or Highest Stage
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Lowest Biostratigraphic Zone
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Highest Biostratigraphic Zone
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Lithostratigraphic Terms
ROW.tagdesc: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Group
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Formation
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Member
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Bed
ROW.tagdesc: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the cataloged item was collected.

ROW.title: Identification
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing identification based information.

ROW.title: Identification ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Identified By
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

ROW.title: Date Identified
ROW.tagdesc: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Identification References
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.

ROW.title: Identification Verification Status
ROW.tagdesc: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID/ABCD.

ROW.title: Identification Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the Identification.

ROW.title: Identification Qualifier
ROW.tagdesc: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf." "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

ROW.title: Type Status
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

ROW.title: Taxon
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing taxonomic based information.

ROW.title: Taxon ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Scientific Name ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

ROW.title: Accepted Name Usage ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

ROW.title: Parent Name Usage ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

ROW.title: Original Name Usage ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) in which the terminal element of the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

ROW.title: Name According To ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied. See nameAccordingTo.

ROW.title: Name Published In ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

ROW.title: Taxon Concept ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

ROW.title: Scientific Name
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.

ROW.title: Accepted Name Usage
ROW.tagdesc: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

ROW.title: Parent Name Usage
ROW.tagdesc: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

ROW.title: Original Name Usage
ROW.tagdesc: The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

ROW.title: Name According To
ROW.tagdesc: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.

ROW.title: Name Published In
ROW.tagdesc: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

ROW.title: Name Published In Year
ROW.tagdesc: The four-digit year in which the scientificName was published.

ROW.title: Higher Classification
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record. Recommended best practice is to order the list starting with the highest rank and separating the names for each rank with a semi-colon ;

ROW.title: Kingdom
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Phylum
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Class
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Order
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Family
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Genus
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

ROW.title: Subgenus
ROW.tagdesc: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

ROW.title: Specific Epithet
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

ROW.title: Infraspecific Epithet
ROW.tagdesc: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

ROW.title: Taxon Rank
ROW.tagdesc: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Verbatim Taxon Rank
ROW.tagdesc: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

ROW.title: Scientific Name Authorship
ROW.tagdesc: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

ROW.title: Vernacular Name
ROW.tagdesc: A common or vernacular name.

ROW.title: Nomenclatural Code
ROW.tagdesc: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is constructed. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Taxonomic Status
ROW.tagdesc: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Nomenclatural Status
ROW.tagdesc: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

ROW.title: Taxon Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

ROW.title: Resource Relationship
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing relationships between resources based information.

ROW.title: Resource Relationship ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for an instance of relationship between one resource (the subject) and another (relatedResource, the object).

ROW.title: Resource ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of the relationship.

ROW.title: Related Resource ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for a related resource (the object, rather than the subject of the relationship).

ROW.title: Relationship Of Resource
ROW.tagdesc: The relationship of the resource identified by relatedResourceID to the subject (optionally identified by the resourceID). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Relationship According To
ROW.tagdesc: The source (person, organization, publication, reference) establishing the relationship between the two resources.

ROW.title: Relationship Established Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date-time on which the relationship between the two resources was established. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Relationship Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes about the relationship between the two resources.

ROW.title: Measurement Or Fact
ROW.tagdesc: *Main structure* containing measurement based information.

ROW.title: Measurement ID
ROW.tagdesc: An identifier for the MeasurementOrFact (information pertaining to measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

ROW.title: Measurement Type
ROW.tagdesc: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

ROW.title: Measurement Value
ROW.tagdesc: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

ROW.title: Measurement Accuracy
ROW.tagdesc: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

ROW.title: Measurement Unit
ROW.tagdesc: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

ROW.title: Measurement Determined Date
ROW.tagdesc: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

ROW.title: Measurement Determined By
ROW.tagdesc: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

ROW.title: Measurement Method
ROW.tagdesc: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

ROW.title: Measurement Remarks
ROW.tagdesc: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.
